intro: Pentacalia basitruncata, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
